name: intern
content:
intern noun [C]
(MEDICAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
US (UK house officer) a doctor working in a hospital who is in their first year after completing their medical degree : The popular TV series is about surgical interns doing their residency at a hospital in Seattle. He was an intern working the emergency room at a county hospital. He first saw a living heart in 1933 while he was a young intern at New Orleans Charity Hospital.

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
Students & pupils
intern noun [C]
(TEMPORARY WORKER)
someone who is working for a company or organization for a period of time, sometimes without pay, in order to get experience of a particular type of work: She worked in the White House as an intern. Hiring interns has helped the company manage its growth while cultivating future employees.

intern verb
(PUT IN PRISON)
[ T often passive ] uk
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ɪnˈtɜːn/ us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ˈɪn.tɝːn/ to put someone in prison for political or military reasons, especially during a war: Many foreigners were interned for the duration of the war.

intern verb
(WORK)
[ I ] uk
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ˈɪn.tɜːn/ us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ˈɪn.tɝːn/ to work for a company or organization for a period of time, sometimes without pay, in order to get experience of a particular type of work: He moved away from marketing after he interned at a cereal company. Melvin, who had interned for a rental-car business in college, became a manager in the company.

world history to put someone in prison for political or military reasons internment noun [ U ] us/ɪnˈtɜrn·mənt/
someone who is receiving training by obtaining practical experience of a type of work
Add to word list
Add to word list
HR, WORKPLACE a student, or someone who has recently finished their studies, who works for a company or organization for a short time, sometimes without being paid, in order to get experience of a particular type of work: After I graduate, I plan to work as an intern at an advertising agency. a student/college/summer intern See also
internship
HR, WORKPLACE to work for a company or organization for a short time, sometimes without being paid, in order to get experience of a particular type of work: He's interning for nine months at the Environmental Education Center in the Cuyahoga Valley National Park.
